wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant General Sydney Rigby Wason ,  and Bar (27 September 1887 – 17 March 1969) was a senior British Army officer in the Second World War.

response: Gort had sent Lieutenant General Ronald Adam, commanding III Corps, ahead to build the defensive perimeter around Dunkirk; his corps command passed to Lieutenant General Sydney Rigby Wason from the GHQ staff.Grehan 2018, Chapter 4 Lieutenant General Alan Brooke, commanding II Corps, was to conduct a holding action with the 3rd, 4th, 5th, and 50th Divisions along the Ypres-Comines canal as far as Yser, while the rest of the BEF fell back. The battle of Wytschaete, over the border in Belgium, was the toughest action Brooke faced in this role.Thompson 2009, pp. 174–178.
* Lieutenant General Sydney Rigby Wason CB, MC and Bar (1887 – 1969), a senior officer in the Second World War.
GOC: Lieutenant-General Sir Ronald Forbes Adam (Lieutenant-General Sydney Rigby Wason after 26 May 1940Grehan 2018, Chapter 4)

response: * Major General Royal Artillery: Major General Sydney Rigby Wason
